It's time for a tip from our Student Support Services team!

Today, we feature the wise words of child psychiatrist Bruce Perry, MD, PhD: "The major way that that human beings really regulate is in context of other people. This program was born out of a collaborative partnership between Harris-Stowe State University and St. Louis Public Schools' Finish Line, For Life! graduation committee to offer a dual enrollment program targeted specifically to seniors who typically would not believe college to be a viable post-secondary option. The intent of the program model is to bolster and rally district resources around getting all seniors to the proverbial finish line-participation in a high school graduation ceremony in May.

Students selected receive textbooks, tutoring and mentoring support. and access to countless resources on campus to support them in their quest to meet a second critical milestone-earning a college degree in a career/field of their choice.

Special thanks to local and state leaders who offered kind words for the departing members of the SAB, including Dr. Margie Vandeven of the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, Lieutenant Governor Mike Kehoe of the State of Missouri, Valerie Bell of the St. Louis Public Schools Foundation, Richard McClure of the United Way of Greater St. Louis, Kathy Reeves of Enterprise and President Lewis Reed of the City of St. Louis Board of Aldermen.

To learn more about the members of the Board of Education of the City of St. Louis, click here: https://www.slps.org/Page/30734.
